context.description:
**This operator is deprecated.** Use HTTPRequest operator instead.
Periodically connects to an HTTP endpoint to GET JSON content as a single tuple. The JSON content is assigned to the `jsonString` attribute in the output tuple which must be of type `rstring`.

metric.name: nFailedRequests
metric.description: Number of HTTP requests that failed, did not return response 200.

parameter.name: acceptAllCertificates
parameter.description: Accept all SSL certificates, even those that are self-signed. Setting this option will allow potentially insecure connections. Default is false.

parameter.name: contentAttribute
parameter.description: Output attribute to assign content to.

parameter.name: extraHeaders
parameter.description: Extra headers to send with request, format is "Header-Name: value"

parameter.name: initDelay
parameter.description: Delay in seconds before the operator starts producing tuples.

parameter.name: iterations
parameter.description: The number of tuples to submit. Negative value or zero means continually fetch and submit tuples.

parameter.name: period
parameter.description: Polling period in seconds. Tuples will be fetched every `period` seconds.

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: URL to HTTP GET content from.

outputPortSet.description: Content of the HTTP GET request as an JSON attribute. Each successful HTTP request that returns a content results in a submitted tuple with an rstring attribute containing the returned content.
